citation.article-title: Numerical analysis of 295 phenotypic features of 266 Xanthomonas strains and related strains and an improved taxonomy of the genus.

p.s: In Bergey's Manual of Systematic Bacteriology (6), Bradbury states that X . populi probably belongs to the genus Xanthomonas. Characteristics of this species are shown in Table 2. From the dendrogram in Fig. 1 it is clear that X. populi forms a separate phenotypic entity that can be differentiated from the other Xanthomonas species. Features that differentiate this organism from other species are shown in Table 2. Phenotypically, X. populi most closely resembles X. albilineans and X. axonopodis. The phenotypic centrotype is strain Rid√© Bt3 (= LMG 972). The type strain is strain NCPPB 2959 (= LMG 5743). The G+C range is 62 to 65 mol%.
